conclusion: To determine the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during their acceleration phases, analyze the v-t graph.
Identify the acceleration phases: A from t=0 to t=t0, B from t=0 to t=2t0.
The velocity of particle A increases linearly from 0 to 2v0 over time interval 0 to t0.
The slope of the velocity-time graph represents acceleration.
Acceleration a_A for particle A is given by a_A = (2v0 - 0)/(t0 - 0) = 2v0/t0.
The velocity of particle B increases linearly from 0 to v0 over time interval 0 to 2t0.
Acceleration a_B for particle B is given by a_B = (v0 - 0)/(2t0 - 0) = v0/2t0.
Calculate the ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration: Ratio = (2v0/t0)/(v0/2t0) = 4.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their acceleration phases is 4:1.
